question_content.barrons:question: In a certain state, each license plate consists of either three digits (between 0 and 9, inclusive) followed by two letters or three letters followed by two digits. For example, 055-XY, 123-PP, and AAA-70 are all acceptable plates. How many different license plates can the state issue?
question_content.barrons:explanation:
2,433,600

If you use the counting principle, this question can be answered by simple arithmetic, which you should do with the calculator.

• License plates with three digits followed by two letters: there are 10 ways to choose each of the digits and 26 ways to choose each of the letters, so there are 10 × 10 × 10 × 26 × 26 = 676,000 plates in this format.

• License plates with three letters followed by two digits: again, there are 26 ways to choose each letter and 10 ways to choose each digit, so there are 26 × 26 × 26 × 10 x 10 = 1,757,600 plates in this format.

• Finally, there are 676,000 + 1,757,600 = 2,433,600 different plates that can be issued.
